msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides. Almost regularly cut at the top. 3 kollesis: at the middle of col. 139, between col. 139 and 140 and before the payments of col. 140. As many of tax Roll columns, the upper and lower part of col. 139 are broken. The beginning of five lines are lost. The papyrus is vertical broken between the lines and payments as a result of a fold. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Patkonnis, son of Mysthes, grandson of Patkonnis, mother Taonnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 200)
Maron, son of Petheus the younger, grandson of Anchorymphis, mother Apollonous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)

Gaios Julius Apolinarius (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Tasoucharion, daughter of Sokrates (alias Petalion) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 239)
Petesouchos, son of Petheus, grandson of Petesouchos, mother Stiunchis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Petaus the brother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Psenesis, son of Pharmenion, grandson of Psenesis, mother Tkonnos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)

Diodoros, bastard, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Kastor slave of Aphrodous, daughter of Dios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Petesouchos, son of Petesouchos, grandson of Petesouchos, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Isidoros the brother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Anoubas, son of Horos, grandson of Anoubas, mother Tepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Onnophris bastard, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Petheus, son of Ptollis, grandson of Herakles, mother Thases (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Karanos, son of Orsenouphis, grandson of Imouthes, mother Tapetsiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 180)
Petermouthis, son of Kastor, grandson of Herakles, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Chairemon, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Pasoxis, mother Tanephremis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
